bibl.title: Letter from George A. Kellogg to Morris Fishbein, July 29, 1941

div1.p: Kellogg informs Fishbein that they will supply inserts of Cornwell's "Conquerors of Yellow Fever" for Hench's "Hygeia" article.

div1.head: Letter from George A. Kellogg to Morris Fishbein, July 29, 1941
div1.opener:
July 29, 1941
Morris Fishbein, M.D.
Editor, Journal of the
American Medical As'an.
535 North Dearborn Street
Chicago, Illinois
Dear Dr Fishbein:
div1.p:
I have consulted our engraver and printer and find that we will
be able to deliver 125,000 inserts printed on one side with a four-
color process reproduction of the Cornwell painting, “Conquerors of
Yellow Fever” not later than September 5th. This delivery, I believe
will be in time for your October issue of HYGEIA. I will send you a
proof of the insert before it is actually run as I think you should
okay it.

I am sure that the NEW YORK SUNDAY MIRROR would be pleased to
have you reproduce the material on page 11 of the Sunday edition recently
sent you. However, inasmuch as this was rotogravure you could not use
the same plates. We are interested in having a quantity of illustrated
material of the nature used in the MIRROR included with Dr. Hench's
article and if it would make any difference to you we shall be glad to
pay for new halftones. We could either send you new glossy prints from
which you could make your own halftones or we can have them made here.

I don't know just what pictures Dr. Hench may have sent you but
we have a large variety. In case you need any additional illustrated
material, please do not hesitate to let me know.

I presume that your publishing department will not be able to
give us a price on 25,000 reprints until after the book has been made
up. We will be glad to cooperate in any way you suggest.

closer.seg:
P.S. To save time I am enclosing five glossy prints as well as five
others of which I don't have glossy reproductions on hand. Glossy
prints can easily be obtained of these or any other should you care
to have them.
GAK:L
